title.value: Facing AI extinction: Why do many of today’s artificial intelligence researchers dismiss the potential risks to humanity?
title.justification: The title captures the essence of the paper, which discusses the risks AI poses to humanity and why these are often dismissed by researchers.
title.quote: Facing AI extinction: Why do many of today’s artificial intelligence researchers dismiss the potential risks to humanity, asks David Krueger

extractions.description: The paper discusses the potential risks of artificial intelligence to humanity, specifically the concept of AI extinction risk. It explores why many AI researchers dismiss these risks and emphasizes the need for robust public discussion and regulation.

type.justification: The paper involves an empirical discussion on AI risks based on observations and experiences of the author in the field.
type.quote: Yet after 10 years in the field, I believe the main reasons are actually cultural and historical.

name.justification: The paper focuses on the ethical concerns surrounding AI, particularly regarding human extinction risks.
name.quote: By refusing to engage, some AI researchers are neglecting ethical responsibilities and betraying public trust.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on the risks AI poses to humanity, specifically the concept of AI extinction risk.
name.quote: AI x-risk is admittedly more speculative than important social issues with present-day AI, like bias and misinformation, but the basic solution is the same: regulation.
